I will begin taking the morning dosage on day 4 and can't wait to see the results.

thread.title: Cheat Meals Get A Lot Of Hate—Here’s How To Make Them Work For You – What's Good by V
thread.title_full: Cheat Meals Get A Lot Of Hate—Here’s How To Make Them Work For You – What's Good by V

posts.author: Colleen De Bellefonds
posts.title: Cheat Meals Get A Lot Of Hate—Here’s How To Make Them Work For You – What's Good by V
posts.text:
Cheat Meals Get A Lot Of Hate—Here’s How To Make Them Work For You 
Posted on by Colleen de Bellefonds 
Many of us associate dieting with swearing off all cheats, treats, and comfort foods—but what if we could have our cake and lose weight, too? 
Trying to stick to a too-strict diet can ultimately make healthy eating unattainable, says nutritionist Torey Armul, R.D., spokesperson for the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics . So enjoying the occasional ketchup-covered fry or gooey brownie can actually be a smart move and help you maintain an overall healthy diet in the long haul. “Occasional indulgences can reduce feelings of deprivation, improve satisfaction, and maintain the pleasurable aspect of eating,” she says. 
That’s where the ‘cheat meal’ comes in. This once-in-a-while opportunity to eat purely for your soul is supposed to help you stay true to your fruits and veggies the rest of the time. This way you can stay on-track with your health and fitness goals while still enjoying a good ‘ole Belgian waffle on the weekend. But it’s not all sunshine, abs, and maple syrup . Cheat meals, when mismanaged, have been known to mess with our heads, turn into all-day eat fests, and sabotage our relationship with food. But they don’t have to! 
Think of these meals as treating yourself to something you love (even if it’s not super healthy). In a perfect treat meal world, you’ll embrace every bite and then return to your healthy routine. Yeah, we know that can be harder than it sounds, but with these expert-backed tips, you’ll be a treat meal pro in no time: 1. Plan ahead. 
Don’t just decide last-minute that you’re sick of your diet and need a splurge. Instead, plan for treat meals a meal or two in advance. “A premeditated splurge is better than an impulsive one for getting back to your normal eating habits,” says Armul. Knowing you have a treat coming can motivate you to eat your veggies in the meantime and keep you from spiraling into a black hole of indulging afterward. 2. Don’t call it cheating. 
How we identify our indulgences has a lot of power over whether they become a healthy part of our lifestyle or a problem. So, for many dietitians and psychologists, the biggest issue with cheat meals is the name itself. 
“I don’t like the word ‘cheat,’ because it implies morality, and I think that’s not helpful when you’re approaching weight control,” says Edward Abramson, Ph.D ., professor emeritus of psychology at California State University, Chico and author of Emotional Eating: What You Need to Know Before Starting Your Next Diet . 
“The idea of a cheat meal creates a feeling that you’re being ‘bad,’ not ‘good,’ which is a moral dichotomy that shouldn’t apply to food,” agrees nutritionist Jessica Levinson, R.D., founder of Small Bites by Jessica . So spare yourself unnecessary guilt and reframe them as ‘treat meals’ instead. We’ll call them by that name from now on, too. 3. Keep it rational. 
Indulging doesn’t mean scarfing down all the yummies from Friday to Monday. Take an 80/20 approach to treating yourself, says nutritionist Christy Brisette, R.D., president of 80 Twenty Nutrition . Eat as healthy as possible 80 percent of the time and enjoy your favorite eats during the rest. And remember that portions still count when you do treat yourself. “Calorically, one cheat meal can negate many days’ worth of healthy eating,” says Armul. So eat intuitively and stop when you’re 80 percent full, she says. 
If you want to break your treats up throughout the week instead of having one full treat meal, pick one thing—like that cocktail, a side of fries, or a dessert—to enjoy every few days, Brisette recommends. 4. Fill in the gaps with healthier goodies. 
Between treat meals, don’t just ignore your cravings. Instead, find healthier ways to satisfy your cravings throughout the week. The more nutritiously you can satisfy your cravings, the better. Some ideas: Trade ice cream for frozen yogurt with fruit, or a double-cheeseburger for a bun-less burger with avocado and baked sweet potato fries , says Levinson. Swap a chocolate chip cookie for a quality dark chocolate bar , for example, and you’ll not only down fewer calories, but enjoy some benefit from the antioxidants in dark chocolate, says Abramson. When you’ve been enjoying your healthy grub all week, you’ll approach your treat meal in a more balanced, less cookie monster-ish way. 5. Go into your treat meal well-fed. 
While it’s tempting to ‘save up’ calories for a delicious dinner (and dessert) out, treating yourself when you’re famished just makes you more likely to go overboard. Make sure you have a healthy meal or snack—which should include filling protein , fiber , and healthy fats—leading up to your treat time, so you’re not as tempted to go all-out, suggest Brisette and Armul. 6. Eat mindfully. 
Once you’re enjoying that treat meal, take small bites and savor them. “The more you focus on sensations like the flavor and texture, the longer it will take to eat the food and the more satisfied you’ll feel,” says Abramson. When you eat mindfully, it becomes almost impossible to binge because you’ll be more aware of when you’re really full. 7. Check in with yourself. 
Keep track of how your treat meals affect your weight and whether they’re actually helping you stick to your diet. If you’re sticking to other parts of a healthy routine but still notice tighter-fitting clothes, you may need to reevaluate treat meals. 
And get real with yourself about your eating behaviors after those treat meals. “For some people every healthy decision increases momentum for the next one, and the same can be true for unhealthy choices,” says Sherry Pagoto, Ph.D., licensed clinical psychologist specializing in diet and nutrition and professor at the University of Connecticut. So ask yourself: After your treat meal, do you go back to your usual diet, or do you sometimes continue on the treat yourself train? 
If you do go tend to go overboard, give yourself a break. “We make over 200 eating decisions each day— so no one is going to get them all right,” says Abramson. Don’t expect yourself to eat 100 percent clean 100 percent of the time! Consider every decision a new opportunity to get your healthy eating back on track. If your treat meals regularly spin out of control and you can’t stop once you start—even when you feel full—though, you may want to meet with a mental health professional, Abramson says. These treat meal mishaps may indicate some turmoil in your relationship with food and mental health. Watch Out For These Treat Meal Saboteurs 
While splurging once in a while can be super helpful when you’re trying to stick with healthy eating long-term, it’s easy to lose perspective. Here are a few slippery slopes to watch out for so you can either make treat meals healthier for your lifestyle—or identify if they’re not right for you: 1. Don’t deprive yourself the rest of the time. 
If one treat meal Oreo turns into the entire sleeve, chances are you’re depriving yourself in the rest of your diet. And when treat meals become treat days and treat weekends, you end up sabotaging your initial goals anyway, says Armul. Your treat meals are only as helpful as the rest of your diet is balanced and nourishing. 2. Never eat until you feel sick. 
This is a major no-go for healthily incorporating treat meals. When you keep eating even though you’re stuffed, you may be tempted to under-eat the next day, which will leave you wildly hungry and likely to just binge again, starting a nasty cycle of binging and restricting, says Brisette. Not only does this pattern of eating mess with your head and your relationship with food, but it’s also tough on your digestive system and throws your blood sugar out of whack. 3. Don’t beat yourself up if you overindulge. 
“Watching your weight requires energy and concentration, and if you get discouraged and angry with yourself, it’s hard to maintain the motivation,” says Abramson. It’s easy to feel guilty after a treat meal turns into a treat weekend, but use this opportunity to understand what leads to you overindulging. 
Depriving yourself throughout the rest of the week is a big culprit here, as are emotional eating (more on that in a sec) and social situations like parties. Self-awareness can go a long way in preventing future treat meal snowballs, though, so being tuned into your patterns can help you make sure treat meals don’t sabotage your goals. 4. Avoid emotional eating. 
One of the biggest treat meal mistakes is eating to forget you’re upset, bored, or stressed, which tangles up our biological need for food with our emotions. “It’s okay to eat when you’re physically hungry, not when you’re just emotionally aroused,” says Abramson. So when you’re really itching for a treat, stop to ask yourself why you want it. Are you hungry—or are you actually pissed at your partner, feeling tired, or worried about something at work? 
As soon as you identify that you want to eat for emotional reasons, distract yourself, says Abramson. Take a bath, go for a walk around the block, or make a mug of tea . “Cravings aren’t permanent. If you can distract yourself, they’ll go away,” he says. 5. Consider treat meals with any health concerns in mind. 
Treat meals are tricky territory: They have the potential to cloud our relationship with food if we aren’t careful in how we use them. If you have a history of eating disorders or are unsure how to make them a healthy part of your diet, talk to your doc to decide how to best approach them. 
The same goes for chronic health conditions. “If you have diabetes, for example, having a large amount of carbohydrates or sugar in a single sitting will cause your blood sugar levels to skyrocket,” says Brisette. That doesn’t mean you can’t enjoy the occasional goody—but a qualified health professional can help you delight in your favorite treats in a healthful way. Share this:

posts.text: it says that it has no other ingredients than the ones labeled, so what they did is separate how the capsule is made: Gelatin capsule, Cellulose, Maltodrextrin and Magnesium Stearate. this is refer as the material of the capsule and the filler used to not leave it empty. is not the first time that we have bad experiences with solaray, they even have products that are labeled "vegetarian capsules" but they are really gelatin, they do not describe where does the magnesium stearate comes from, if is either synthetic, from vegetable or animal source, you are better off finding cleaner brands like the key company, time honored formulas or bluebonnet nutritions, at least they don't use any extra additives and they do come clean about where they get their product, and for all the offended vegans out there, this is an enzyme, and the source of it of course has to be animal if you want it to be efficient, most of them are from porcine stomach, but anyways, going natural or synthetic is a personal choice, I just wouldn't recommend this brand because is really hard on sensitive stomachs, and they have misleading labels

thread.title: Bentonite Indian Healing Clay - 1 Pound Clay
thread.title_full: Bentonite Indian Healing Clay - 1 Pound Clay

posts.author: BritBrat27
posts.text: This is maybe the 3rd review I've ever written. But I had to say how much I LOVE this mask. When I say I have sensitive skin, I mean I have send-a-tube skin. The ONLY face was I can use is Cetaphil Gentle Skin cleanser, and I can use Cere-Ve moisturizer, Vaseline and pure shea butter on my face. Anything else and I break out. I also use retin-a nightly. Also in the evening I add a bit of organic brown sugar to my cleanser for exfoliation. I know they say you shouldn't do that every night, but it works with my skin. I don't really have acne if I stick to my routine. But I do get a stray pimple every now and then (usually around the same time every month... imagine that ) and no matter how diligent I am (and I am) I can't get rid of the blackheads on my nose. I decided to give this a try hoping it wouldn't cause any sort of reaction to my skin. I've been using it about 3X a week for 3 weeks now and OMG what a difference. My blackheads have shrunk considerably. My skin looks brighter by far and it's SO SMOOTH. Seriously when I wash my face I feel like my hands are just gliding over marble or something. It's amazing. The "pulsing" feeling is very mild for me and actually very relaxing. I like to put the mask on, close my eyes and just breathe deep while it dries. Oh, side note: it's easiest to take off in the shower with a wash cloth. DON'T rub, just wet with warm water and hold over face to soften and "pat"it off. It really doesn't take long, then just dry off and get in your pj's!

You have to take the whole thing like the directions state and let me tell you it does not taste good ( combined with cranberry juice helped a lot with taste) and I had an awesome vacation and it worked just as well as antibiotics without the side effects. I will probably start taking a supplement for daily support of the Urinary tract as i am prone to UTI's

I would definitely recommend this product to all my friends who are trying to get in shape! Will definitely buy again!!

posts.author: Chef Rob
posts.text: Lost over 100 lbs using this product in a year and a half along with diet and exercise.

thread.title: Bentonite Indian Healing Clay - 1 Pound Clay
thread.title_full: Bentonite Indian Healing Clay - 1 Pound Clay

posts.author: chey
posts.text: Extremely satisfied with this product!! I highly recommend it! Saw immediate improvements with the first use (smaller pores, smoother skin, clear acne). I mixed it with just water and saw tremendous results.

posts.author: Carrie
posts.text: Love, love, love this product. I have been on so many medicines, to doctors, and I can never seem to get something that truly makes me feel better. This product was the perfect solution and I'm so happy a friend introduced it to me. Really relieves me of all my stomach issues.

posts.author: Dee
posts.text: Had purchased these vitamins in the past. Always give me a horrible somach ache with nausea. Tried crushing them, taking them with milk and also taking with a full stomach. Same result.

posts.author: Honest Review
posts.text: Very moderate energy increase. Experienced slight stomach pains after taking without food. Urine will be extremely yellow. Took maximum 4 twice a day but didn't feel a significant difference. Will not experience any effects that you would for prescribed medication.

thread.title: Floradix + Herbs - 8.5 Fluid Ounces Liquid
thread.title_full: Floradix Iron + Herbs - 8.5 Fluid Ounces Liquid

posts.author: ann
posts.text: After my husband had surgery he was anemic hemo 7.6 and hemotocrit 21.6 now after take 10 ml, 2 x a day , 2 weeks later he is 12.6 hemo and hemotocrit 37.7 . Amazing . No constipation a plus .

posts.author: Nick
posts.text:
I started this product on a Sunday morning and by Thursday I had lost 13 lbs! Just could not believe this!
If you follow the easy instructions and stay on drinking this product when advised it will work and you wont be hungry! I did eat small amounts of fruit with this product that were low in sugar.

posts.author: True Believer
posts.title: Male Drive Maximum Formula - 60 Capsules
posts.text: This product actually works the best part about it is the GUARENTEED MONEY BACK PROGRAM if it doesn't work! However just what the bottle says it works gives you more energy, endurance, and vitality. I have no complaints when it comes to this product and the price is spot on.

posts.author: Kg1907
posts.text: I mix 1/2 tablespoon in half a glass of orange Juice morning and night. The orange juice masks the taste long enough to chug it down. I have been doing it a week and have noticed an increase in my milk supply.

posts.author: Lana
posts.title: Mineral Body Spray - 4 Fluid Liquid
posts.text: I love Crystal Deodorant Mineral Spray. It feels light and leaves no residue while being effective. I don't have to worry about it staining my clothes. I prefer the Chamomile and Green Tea scent.

posts.author: MTB
posts.text: Great taste. I love the dark chocolate flavor. The texture is smooth. I drink one of these about an hour before I play hockey for a snack. I can't wait to try more flavors

posts.author: Nurse Hatchet
posts.title: Protein Rush - 4
posts.text: My mom buys a protein Rush cookies and cream for me a drink at about 5:30 in the morning it takes me through the whole day I'm not hungry until about 1:30 in the afternoon

posts.author: Rose
posts.text: I think these crunch bars are pretty good, but they're small, not filling enough. Otherwise great.

posts.author: MAS
posts.text: Love these bars in all flavors I have tried so far.

posts.author: Cheri
posts.text: My family loves L&L and Snickerdoodle USED TO be a family favorite. However, recently they started tasting like molasses or gingerbread cookies. They don't taste anything like Snickerdoodle. We are sooo disappointed with this change.

posts.author: Zyzel14
posts.text:
---The new Chocolate Brownie Bar tastes AWFUL It tastes like 20 packets of Equal, Sweet'N Low, and Splenda combined were dumped into the bar.
---A consumer representative stated in an email that Quest removed the palm oil and added "a little bit of sugar alcohol."

posts.author: annie7
posts.text: I first got one of these cookies at my favorite drugstore down the street and when I brought it to check out with the pharmacist - a similar health enthusiast - she told me ohhh thats my favorite! Only then did I start to do my research into this cookie. The Vitamin shoppe's cookies are soft and amazing whereas ones I have ordered direct from manufacturer feel a bit dry and old at times! Thank you for offering these!

posts.author: Michelle
posts.text: I used to buy boxes of these several times a month. In the last 6 months or so, they have changed the recipe. The new one is terrible. Both the taste and texture are different. I asked my local VS store and sent an email to Lenny & Larry's and they said something about there being inconsistencies due to there being 2 different processing places, but that is not it. None of the other flavors have this new texture (like thicker and lumpy). I don't plan on buying the chocolate chip flavor again. The other kinds are still good.

posts.author: di
posts.text: Eat one every day and look forward to getting the protein and feels like a desert too! Can't ask for more!!!

posts.author: Jambo
posts.text: Often buy in store. Customer service is great.

posts.author: allensc
posts.text: After reading all the postive feedback on these bars. I decided to give them a try. Doesn't taste nowhere like peanut butter. To be honest. Have no idea what they remind me off, but definitely not pb.

posts.author: good appetite
posts.text: This is the first appetite suppressant I have ever used that does not have a single side effect. There is no speediness, no there is no sweating, there's no heat, you take the vitamin and it removes your appetite very simple. I have tried many over the years but really and truly this is the first one I've ever had that removes my appetite.
